title: Eiffel’s descendants say non to keeping Olympic rings on Eiffel Tower
content: The Paris mayor wants the Olympic logo to stay on the monument. Gustave Eiffel’s descendants say the tower shouldn’t be a permanent billboard.
summary: The Paris mayor wants the Olympic logo to stay on the monument. Gustave Eiffel’s descendants say the tower shouldn’t be a permanent billboard.

title: Russian counteroffensive in Ukrainian-controlled Kursk begins, says Zelensky
content: Zelensky said that the Russian counteroffensive had long been expected and was planned for.
summary: Zelensky said that the Russian counteroffensive had long been expected and was planned for.

title: Kyiv’s bombed children’s hospital rebuilds, and one boy heads home
content: Hundreds with severe medical needs were displaced by July’s missile strike on Okhmatdyt Children’s Hospital in Kyiv, but the hospital was rebuilt and many returned.
summary: Hundreds with severe medical needs were displaced by July’s missile strike on Okhmatdyt Children’s Hospital in Kyiv, but the hospital was rebuilt and many returned.

title: A new crisis may plunge Libya back into chaos
content: The recent dramas gripping the country have been shadowy, shaped by backroom deals, black market transfers and illicit smuggling.
summary: The recent dramas gripping the country have been shadowy, shaped by backroom deals, black market transfers and illicit smuggling.

title: Is the new statue of the late Queen Elizabeth II really that ... bad?
content: The newly unveiled sculpture at Antrim Castle Gardens in Northern Ireland was compared online to Robin Williams’s character in the 1993 movie “Mrs. Doubtfire.”
summary: The newly unveiled sculpture at Antrim Castle Gardens in Northern Ireland was compared online to Robin Williams’s character in the 1993 movie “Mrs. Doubtfire.”

title: Afghan women defy Taliban and continue medical school in Scotland
content: The Scottish government granted free tuition to female students from Afghanistan to continue studying medicine after the Taliban upended their education.
summary: The Scottish government granted free tuition to female students from Afghanistan to continue studying medicine after the Taliban upended their education.

title: U.N. agency says six of its staff among those killed in Israeli strikes
content: The workers were killed when two airstrikes hit a Gaza refugee camp, said UNRWA, the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees. Israel said it targeted Hamas militants.
summary: The workers were killed when two airstrikes hit a Gaza refugee camp, said UNRWA, the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees. Israel said it targeted Hamas militants.

title: Gaza’s traumatized children are facing another lost year of school
content: About 650,000 students are missing their second school year, an absence educators say will compound the trauma of war and could cause lasting developmental problems.
summary: About 650,000 students are missing their second school year, an absence educators say will compound the trauma of war and could cause lasting developmental problems.

title: More than half of Brazil is racked by drought. Blame deforestation.
content: Latin America’s largest country is being baked by its worst drought on record.
summary: Latin America’s largest country is being baked by its worst drought on record.

title: Iran turns to Hells Angels and other criminal gangs to target critics
content: Iran has cultivated ties with criminal networks in the West to carry out a recent wave of violent plots in the United States and Europe.
summary: Iran has cultivated ties with criminal networks in the West to carry out a recent wave of violent plots in the United States and Europe.

title: Which countries have suspended or restricted arms sales to Israel?
content: Canada is the latest country to suspend some weapons exports, amid scrutiny over military aid to Israel as the war in Gaza nears the one-year mark.
summary: Canada is the latest country to suspend some weapons exports, amid scrutiny over military aid to Israel as the war in Gaza nears the one-year mark.

title: Amid Gaza talks, U.S. releases $1.3 billion in military aid to Egypt
content: The Biden administration had previously withheld some annual funding from Egypt amid scrutiny of its human rights record.
summary: The Biden administration had previously withheld some annual funding from Egypt amid scrutiny of its human rights record.

title: New video, witnesses challenge Israel’s account of U.S. activist’s killing
content: The IDF said Aysenur Eygi was shot “unintentionally” during a “violent riot.” A Post analysis shows clashes had subsided and protesters had retreated.
summary: The IDF said Aysenur Eygi was shot “unintentionally” during a “violent riot.” A Post analysis shows clashes had subsided and protesters had retreated.

title: Biden ‘outraged’ by U.S. activist’s death; Israel kills dozens in Gaza strikes
content: Israel carried out at least four airstrikes in Gaza and mounted raids in two West Bank villages.
summary: Israel carried out at least four airstrikes in Gaza and mounted raids in two West Bank villages.

title: As U.S. and Ukraine debate arms restrictions, Blinken visits Kyiv
content: Kyiv’s attempt to sway the Biden administration comes as Ukraine has faced heavy bombardment from Russia in recent days — especially on its power sector.
summary: Kyiv’s attempt to sway the Biden administration comes as Ukraine has faced heavy bombardment from Russia in recent days — especially on its power sector.

title: Trump debate claims about German energy policy are wrong, says Berlin
content: “We are shutting down — not building — coal and nuclear plants,” Germany’s Foreign Ministry said on social media in response to Trump’s debate comments.
summary: “We are shutting down — not building — coal and nuclear plants,” Germany’s Foreign Ministry said on social media in response to Trump’s debate comments.

title: House GOP maneuvers to portray Democrats as weak on China
content: With its “China Week” blitz of legislation, the House GOP seeks to bolster the party’s foreign policy credentials ahead of November’s election.
summary: With its “China Week” blitz of legislation, the House GOP seeks to bolster the party’s foreign policy credentials ahead of November’s election.

title: Global outlets pick apart debate, with many saying Harris came out on top
content: Reactions to the Trump-Harris debate showed how closely countries are watching for signs of how November’s presidential election could affect their U.S. ties.
summary: Reactions to the Trump-Harris debate showed how closely countries are watching for signs of how November’s presidential election could affect their U.S. ties.

title: Meet Margarita Simonyan, queen of Russia’s covert information wars
content: While the Kremlin has denied U.S. accusations of information operations, Simonyan proudly admits that her work is at the behest of the Russian government.
summary: While the Kremlin has denied U.S. accusations of information operations, Simonyan proudly admits that her work is at the behest of the Russian government.
